ingdom Hearts codedÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â‚¬Â¹ (ÃƒÂ£Ã¢â‚¬Å¡Ã‚Â­ÃƒÂ£Ã†â€™Ã‚Â³ÃƒÂ£Ã¢â‚¬Å¡Ã‚Â°ÃƒÂ£Ã†â€™Ã¢â€šÂ¬ÃƒÂ£Ã†â€™Ã‚Â  ÃƒÂ£Ã†â€™Ã‚ï¿½ÃƒÂ£Ã†â€™Ã‚Â¼ÃƒÂ£Ã†â€™Ã¢â‚¬Å¾ ÃƒÂ£Ã¢â‚¬Å¡Ã‚Â³ÃƒÂ£Ã†â€™Ã‚Â¼ÃƒÂ£Ã†â€™Ã¢â‚¬Â¡ÃƒÂ£Ã†â€™Ã†â€™ÃƒÂ£Ã†â€™Ã¢â‚¬Â° Kingudamu HÃƒâ€žÃ‚ï¿½tsu KÃƒâ€¦Ã‚ï¿½deddo?) is an episodic puzzle video game developed and published by Square Enix, in collaboration with the Walt Disney Internet Group for mobile phones.[1][2] It is an installment in the Kingdom Hearts series that is set after the events of the Kingdom Hearts II. The story focuses on a message written in Jiminy Cricket\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\'s journal. The game was announced at the 2007 Tokyo Game Show. Currently, the title is only a Japanese release; however, a remake of the game entitled Kingdom Hearts Re:coded will be released in North America, Europe and Japan on the Nintendo DS.[17] The game consists of eight episodes, with the first episode released on June 3, 2009[5], the second episode on July 8, 2009[6][7], the third on August 5, 2009[8][9], the fourth on September 17, 2009[10], the fifth on October 15, 2009[11], the sixth on November 26, 2009, the seventh on December 26, 2009, and the eighth on January 28, 2010. A pre-install episode was also made available on November 18, 2008, before the game\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\'s official release.

Confirmed to work with DSTWO
